description: Commands to manage a DNS Service workload network.

commands.name: az vmware workload-network dns-service create
commands.summary: Create a DNS service by id in a private cloud workload network.
commands.syntax:
az vmware workload-network dns-service create --dns-service
                                              --private-cloud
                                              --resource-group
                                              [--default-dns-zone]
                                              [--display-name]
                                              [--dns-service-ip]
                                              [--fqdn-zones]
                                              [--log-level {DEBUG, ERROR, FATAL, INFO, WARNING}]
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--revision]
examples: az vmware workload-network dns-service create --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --dns-service dnsService1 --display-name dnsService1 --dns-service-ip 5.5.5.5 --default-dns-zone defaultDnsZone1 --fqdn-zones fqdnZone1 --log-level INFO --revision 1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network dns-service delete
commands.summary: Delete a DNS service by id in a private cloud workload network.
commands.syntax:
az vmware workload-network dns-service delete [--dns-service]
                                              [--ids]
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--private-cloud]
                                              [--resource-group]
                                              [--subscription]
                                              [--yes]
examples: az vmware workload-network dns-service delete --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --dns-service dnsService1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network dns-service list
commands.summary: List of DNS services in a private cloud workload network.
examples: az vmware workload-network dns-service list --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network dns-service show
commands.summary: Get a DNS service by id in a private cloud workload network.
examples: az vmware workload-network dns-service show --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --dns-service dnsService1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network dns-service update
commands.summary: Update a DNS service by id in a private cloud workload network.
commands.syntax:
az vmware workload-network dns-service update [--add]
                                              [--default-dns-zone]
                                              [--display-name]
                                              [--dns-service]
                                              [--dns-service-ip]
                                              [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--fqdn-zones]
                                              [--ids]
                                              [--log-level {DEBUG, ERROR, FATAL, INFO, WARNING}]
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--private-cloud]
                                              [--remove]
                                              [--resource-group]
                                              [--revision]
                                              [--set]
                                              [--subscription]
examples: az vmware workload-network dns-service update --resource-group group1 --private-cloud cloud1 --dns-service dnsService1 --display-name dnsService1 --dns-service-ip 5.5.5.5 --default-dns-zone defaultDnsZone1 --fqdn-zones fqdnZone1 --log-level INFO --revision 1

commands.name: az vmware workload-network dns-service wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
